name: Running Workouts
description: Running-based cardio workouts for all levels - from beginner to advanced

exercises.name: Easy Run
exercises.description: Conversational pace running. Foundation of running fitness. Should be able to talk throughout.
instructions: Start with 5-10 minute walking warm-up
Begin running at comfortable, conversational pace
You should be able to speak in full sentences
Focus on steady breathing rhythm
Keep shoulders relaxed, arms at 90 degrees
Land mid-foot, quick cadence (170-180 steps/min)
Cool down with 5 minutes easy walking

modifications.easier: Run-walk intervals (2 min run, 1 min walk), reduce duration
modifications.harder: Increase duration, add light hills, progressive pace (finish faster)

conditions.knee: Soft surfaces if possible, reduce duration, check form
conditions.ankle: Ensure proper shoes, soft surfaces, consider walk-run
conditions.lower_back: Focus on core engagement, avoid excessive lean

exercises.videoSearch: easy run proper form conversational pace

exercises.name: Run-Walk Intervals
exercises.description: Alternating running and walking. Perfect for beginners or recovery. Low-pressure cardio.
instructions: Warm up with 5 minutes walking
Run for designated time at comfortable pace
Walk for recovery interval - catch your breath
Repeat the run-walk cycle
Common ratios: 1 min run / 2 min walk (beginner)
As fitness improves: 2 min run / 1 min walk
Cool down with 5 minutes easy walking

modifications.easier: 1 min run / 3 min walk, reduce total duration
modifications.harder: 3 min run / 1 min walk, progress to continuous running

conditions.knee: Start conservatively, ensure good shoes, flat surfaces

exercises.name: Tempo Run
exercises.description: Comfortably hard pace. Builds speed endurance. Not for low-energy days.
instructions: Warm up with 10-15 minutes easy running
Increase to tempo pace - comfortably hard effort
Breathing is labored but controlled
Can speak short phrases but not full sentences
Maintain steady pace throughout tempo portion
Focus on rhythm and relaxation despite effort
Cool down with 10 minutes easy running

modifications.easier: Shorter tempo duration (10-15 min), slightly slower pace
modifications.harder: Longer tempo (30-40 min), slightly faster pace, add hills

conditions.knee: Ensure fully warmed up, may need to skip if painful
conditions.ankle: May need to skip, higher risk at tempo effort

exercises.name: Hill Repeats
exercises.description: Hard uphill efforts. Builds leg power and running strength. High intensity.
instructions: Warm up with 15 minutes easy running on flat
Find a hill with moderate grade (4-6%)
Run hard uphill for designated time
Focus on strong arm drive, quick turnover
Jog or walk back down for recovery
Recover fully before next repeat
Cool down with 10 minutes easy running

modifications.easier: 4 x 60 sec hills, gentler grade, walk down recovery
modifications.harder: 10 x 2 min hills, steeper grade, shorter recovery

conditions.knee: Extra warm-up essential, may need to skip
conditions.ankle: High risk, likely skip this workout
conditions.calf: High calf load, stretch well, may avoid

exercises.name: Long Slow Run
exercises.description: Weekly long run. Builds aerobic base. Easy conversational pace. Time on feet matters more than speed.
instructions: No warm-up needed - start very easy
First 10-15 minutes should feel ridiculously easy
Settle into comfortable, conversational pace
Focus on steady effort, not speed
Stay relaxed - shoulders down, arms loose
Take walking breaks if needed - no shame
Last 10 minutes can pick up slightly if feeling good

modifications.easier: 30-45 minutes, walk breaks encouraged, very slow pace

conditions.knee: Soft surfaces ideal, listen to body, cut short if pain
conditions.ankle: Ensure good shoes, may need walk breaks

exercises.name: Fartlek Run
exercises.description: Swedish for 'speed play'. Mix fast and easy running based on feel. Unstructured intervals.
instructions: Warm up with 10 minutes easy running
Pick landmarks ahead (tree, lamp post, corner)
Surge to that landmark at faster pace
Recover with easy running until feeling ready
Repeat surges based on how you feel
Surges can be 30 seconds to 3 minutes
Cool down with 10 minutes easy running

modifications.easier: Shorter surges (30-60 sec), more recovery, fewer surges
modifications.harder: Longer surges (2-3 min), less recovery, more surges

conditions.knee: Listen to body, stop surges if painful
